message.content:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: public void execute(){
    String cmd = "\\\\sharedLocation\\server\\adm.exe";
    p = Runtime.getRuntime().exec(cmd);
    InputStream in = p.getInputStream();
    OutputStream out = p.getOutputStream();
    BufferedReader br= new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(in));
    BufferedWriter bw = new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(out));
    bw.write("TRIGGER");
    bw.newLine();
    bw.flush();
    String output = "";
    String line;
    while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
        output += line;
        if (line.endsWith(">")) {
            break;
        }
    }
    System.out.println("Out"+output);
    out.close();
    p.waitFor();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you are not reading the output of the process correctly. You should use BufferedReader.readLine() to read the output line by line. Also, after writing the command to the process's output stream, you should write a newline character and then flush the stream. This is because the process is likely expecting a newline character to signify the end of the command.
